intro: Stachytarpheta obovata, commonly known as the broad-leaf purpletop, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate to obovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically purple or blue in color, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Stachytarpheta obovata is also used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
